page.title: 01Windermere area - general
page.content: The survey area, which is part of the Lake District National Park, is on the southern fringe of the upland mass of the Lakeland fells. The western edge of the area is part of Windermere lake, which is over 10 miles long. Population is concentrated in the western part of the block, the main settlement being the large village of Windermere itself. Farming is the most stable industry and the longest established, concentrating on sheep and cattle. The marvellous scenery of fells and lakes attracts large numbers of visitors from all parts of the world. The summer population explosion brings financial benefits and jobs but various problems as well.
